briefTitle: Vacuum-Assisted Evacuation (VAE) Of Symptomatic and/or Voluminous Breast Haematomas Following Surgeries And Percutaneous Procedures: a Retrospective Analysis
officialTitle: Vacuum-Assisted Evacuation (VAE) Of Symptomatic and/or Voluminous Breast Haematomas Following Surgeries And Percutaneous Procedures: a Retrospective Analysis
conditions: Breast Haematoma, Breast Cancer, Breast Diseases
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Hematoma vacuum assisted biopsy success rate I
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* age between 18 and 75 years old after breast conservative surgery (BCS), VAB or vacuum-assisted excision (VAE) procedure
* Clinically significant and large hematoma (\>25 mm) that do not fulfill the criteria for immediate surgery and cause discomfort, pressure symptoms, infection, or pain classified on VAS \> 3.
* Failure of attempt with FNA
* Patients that refuse surgery

Exclusion Criteria:

* pregnancy
* patients requiring urgent surgery
* Patient follow-up discontinued in our facility
* Symptomatic post-BCS early hematoma
